attachments.fallback: New card [low] it seems like the autocomplete for the front page and /recs/ page updates slower than the rest of the page. For example, Feather can be seen on commander pages, but not front pages and /recs/. It would be nice if it were more up to date now that we get spoilers streaming in more readily. added to list EDHREC Bugs on board edhrec.

attachments.fallback:
David Keatts commented on [low] it seems like the autocomplete for the front page and /recs/ page updates slower than the rest of the page. For example, Feather can be seen on commander pages, but not front pages and /recs/. It would be nice if it were more up to date now that we get spoilers streaming in more readily.: "(my theory is) 2 things were causing this:

1 - I commented out the call to `gulp` in nightly, which meant typeahead.json (and some other small json files) wasn't getting updated except when I manually invoked `gulp` (while working on css/js)

2 - the react app uses rev-manifest (see: <https://edhrec.com/js/rev-manifest-json.json>) to get the right json paths.  I added this a while ago so that e.g. our searchbar doesn't break if I temporarily break a json file.  previously I was including this file in the project source code itself, and it was being updated every build automatically.  but new builds only happen when I'm pushing bugfixes.  so now it queries that link I posted, which gets updated by nightly.

will push out fix with the next react app update w/ salt ui update"
attachments.text:
(my theory is) 2 things were causing this:

1 - I commented out the call to `gulp` in nightly, which meant typeahead.json (and some other small json files) wasn't getting updated except when I manually invoked `gulp` (while working on css/js)

2 - the react app uses rev-manifest (see: <https://edhrec.com/js/rev-manifest-json.json>) to get the right json paths.  I added this a while ago so that e.g. our searchbar doesn't break if I temporarily break a json file.  previously I was including this file in the project source code itself, and it was being updated every build automatically.  but new builds only happen when I'm pushing bugfixes.  so now it queries that link I posted, which gets updated by nightly.

will push out fix with the next react app update w/ salt ui update

attachments.fallback:
David Keatts commented on [medium] salt: for each deck in our database, i want to have a salt score for that deck. to do this, let's try: (salt score of commander ) x 10 + sum(salt score of each card in the deck). Add the salt score to the /deckpreview/ pages. I'm thinking a salt shaker icon to the right of the $/above "Updated:" some decent amount of horizontal space. On /listofdecks/ pages add a salt shaker column and let you sort by salt.: "so I've added salt scores to deckswithprices, but it doesn't include salt score of commander.  now that I think about it, the price column doesn't include the commander either.

so it'd be nice if we could update the sql query (`database.update_deckswithprices()`) to include commander.  I imagine some sort of join and coalesce will do the trick.  I can start iterating on this but the query takes like 30-60 min to run."
attachments.text:
so I've added salt scores to deckswithprices, but it doesn't include salt score of commander.  now that I think about it, the price column doesn't include the commander either.

so it'd be nice if we could update the sql query (`database.update_deckswithprices()`) to include commander.  I imagine some sort of join and coalesce will do the trick.  I can start iterating on this but the query takes like 30-60 min to run.
